enrichment.AboutCourse:
There has never been a better time to become a computing and IT teacher.\r
Our PGCE Secondary Education in Computer Science will teach you to engage young minds with the fundamentals of computing and IT, even learning brand new programming languages, so they can shine in creative industries.\r
We’ll support you in coupling your enthusiasm for computer science with learning about the National Curriculum framework, planning, resourcing and delivering lessons to pupils of all secondary ages and abilities.\r

inst.TrainWithUs:
‘Aspirational training to achieve inspirational teachers with pupils’ learning and well-being at the heart of our partnership’\r
\r
The Catholic Teaching Alliance [North] is underpinned by a shared passion to train and develop outstanding and inspirational teachers who are highly employable and dedicated professionals. We aim to deliver the Catholic school leaders of tomorrow. The Catholic Teaching Alliance [North] is a partnership between primary, secondary and post 16 establishments. We offer outstanding training opportunities and produce outstanding NQTs ready to enter the teaching profession. We are a cross phase alliance of 70 schools based mainly in the Dioceses of Lancaster, Liverpool and Salford. The lead school is Our Lady’s Catholic High School in Preston. The school achieved ‘Outstanding’ in all categories from Ofsted in 2012 and became a National Teaching School in 2014.\r
School Direct placements across the partnership ensure that trainees work alongside outstanding practitioners within high performing schools. We use the best qualified staff with existing expertise to deliver a quality assured training programme to support trainees, based upon the Teachers’ Standards. Working in collaboration with the University of Cumbria we deliver a prestigious training programme consisting of weekly school training days, Pedagogy for Learning days held at the University campus in Lancaster, a weekly professional mentor programme and day to day school mentor support. By using the best qualified and experienced leaders for the delivery and training of bespoke elements of the PGCE, we are confident in ensuring quality training at all levels.\r

AccreditingProviderEnrichments.Description:
The Postgraduate Certificate (PgCE) in Secondary Education Programme\r
offers training in a range of secondary subjects.\r
This full time course enables students to focus on their specialist\r
subject whilst, at the same time, helping them to understand and participate in the wider aspects of school. As it is a Postgraduate Certificate in Education, it entails work at Masters Level (level 7). This recognises the high levels achieved by students on this Programme and rewards this with 60 Masters-level credits. All subject 'Pedagogy for Learning' days are based at the Lancaster campus.
